text: Humbang Hasundutan Regency is a regency in North Sumatra province of Indonesia. It includes part of the southwest shore of Lake Toba of North Sumatra, Indonesia. The regency covers an area of 2,502.71 km2, and according to the 2010 census had a population of 171,687; the latest estimate (for mid 2018) is 188,480.Badan Pusat Statistik, Jakarta, 2020. Its seat is Dolok Sanggul. To the north is Samosir Regency and Pakpak Bharat Regency, to the east is North Tapanuli Regency, and to the south is Central Tapanuli Regency and the Indian Ocean. == Administrative divisions == The regency is divided administratively into ten districts (kecamatan), tabulated below with their 2010 Census population,Biro Pusat Statistik, Jakarta, 2011. together with the estimated populations in mid 2018:Badan Pusat Statistik, Jakarta, 2020.
